content:
Posted: April 12
												Boy oh boy does this game♥♥♥♥♥♥me off.I'll start with what limited positives there are.The game is very open world and its fun to explore the city. With plenty of buildings to jump off of and obliterate the civilians below.If you get bored of 'gliding' arround you can nab a helecoptor and actually fly around and blow♥♥♥♥♥♥up.If you get bored of sprinting, hop in a tank.The gameplay is uneque (well kinda, saints row 4 kinda borrowed some elements of this game later on, so its a little less uneque now.) You have an array of powers at your desposal and you can ingest old people, what more do you want??Thats it. no more good points.The graphics look.. alright I guess. The mane protagonist makes oblivian look photo realistic.The ai is wonky? from what I have seen they sot of spazz a bit? if you do a little jump, every one screams and runs off. EXURSIZE ISNT THAT SCARY! if you murder some one in a crowd, only 2 or 3 people will scream? Is America actually like this or?The enimies... all I can say is stun lock. everything you do can and will be canceled out. wanna attack? stun lock. wanna heal? stun lock. wanna run off? stun lock. This method alone has killed me more times than anything elce. I am currently on the final boss fight and guess what, as soon as the intro for the boss finished. Stun locked to death. wanna use a devistator attack? Well ♥♥♥♥ you cause your gonna get hit by some random thing you didn't see. Why does sothething that can save you live take a full 3-4 seconds to do? There is no point in having it. Its like saying "you have the cure for canser but in order to cure your self, you have to die of cancer." Its ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. I know you can spam the attack if there isnt a delay, but it isnt even that op. you can spam it after any way, just eat a couple people. what is the point in having it, if it takes so long to do, and it can be canceled out but some random civilian taking a cheep shot? SLAPS AREN'T THAT HARD!Your attacks feel less than super human. even upgraded. they barly do damage against the bigger enimies and thats if you can actually land any of your hits. The game discuises this by giving you 'different' abilities to 'mix' togeather to do 'devistating damage'. Devistating lossly translates to in this game as; a teeny bit more damage than befor. at no point in this game did I feel super human, strong, or remotly dangerous. If anything, the people running arround were more thretaning that you are in this game.The sprinting in the game feels like a non-shalont jog and is hard to controll. Jumping doesn't seem all that good either, it doesn't feel as strong when you jump up buildings or jump from building to building as it does when you just stand still and jump. The gliding might as well not be there at all. 2 seconds of horisontal movement then its a plumit back to earth. you can dash in mid air, but even that feels half harted and doesn't always push you farward. The movement feels extreamly sluggish. I have seen more movement in stephen hawking than Mr mercer.sprinting and climbing up buildings can be an♥♥♥♥♥to deal with. So any time have I been sprinting up somehitng for mr mercer to fling himself off for no reason. So after this happens a few times, I decided to sprint round buildings. Nope, just as annoying. Mr mercer decides to jump on buildings willy nilly, flip around and be un helpful in general. The pre alphaa parkor of assassins creed would get you round faster and more efficiantly.The plot is meh... Virus.. you want to stop the virus, ohhh but then you don't.. ohh then "drama". About half way thrugh the game *SPOILERS* your sister gets kidnaped by a massive brute like enimy. I couldn't give two flying ♥♥♥♥s. I was only told that she was "my" sister, no other relationship building at all. She is only there to tell you information to further the plot. I really didn't give a♥♥♥♥♥♥when she got kidnapped at all.Oh, and, I musn't forget to say this. There are escort/protect missions. YAY -_- the game gives you someting to protect, then flings 6 brutes at it at one time, so you have one of three options.1. attack the brutes head on, get stun locked by them, explotions and everything elce then die.2.nab a helecoptor that looses the 1000% acuracy that the NPC's get when they fly it, and shoot at the brutes that way. (Oh and you do damage to the thing you are supposed to protect so you aren't furthering your own cause here.)2.Pinch a tank, and to the same as the helli but with a little more acuracy and you are on the ground. If you go for option 2, good luck with that. See in order to actually get in a helli, you gotta launch yourself at it and press 'E' (for the PC of cource.)((and this is if you can find a hellin on the floor nicely wating for you)) but even if you hit the helli and press the aformantioned 'E' button, 75% of the time nothing will happen. So have fun jumping arround whilst the thing you are supposed to protect is taking 15% damage every 2 seconds.All in all the game is meh.... or even less than that. If you want to get this game, get it on sale. (I normally say cause everything is great on sale, but seriously, it isnt worth £15.)-11/10 would get stun locked so much that I have to pay for a neew monitor and apologise to my gf cause I got so♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off the HULK ain't got nothing on this again.

content:
Posted: November 12, 2012
												Welcome to Manhattan Island, New York. Your name, Alex Mercer,  protagonist.  Roaming the city with a fractured memory, he finds himself not quite what he used to be. Infected with an unknown virus and hunted by the Marines & an insidious Lab called Gentek Alex must survive in order to learn what happened to him. As he progresses throughout the infected city, he learns that the pathogen quickly assimilates every living cell in the human body, even the clothes he wears which makes him virtually the perfect shape shifter. He tracks down his sister &s an old girlfriend who helps him along the way only to find out he does not like what he remembers. In this game you’ll be able to disguise yourself and infiltrate Top Secret Military bases, gain control of Massively Armored Thermobaric Tanks & Fully Weaponized Air Gunships like the AH-64D Apache. Customize Melee/Combo attacks, Upgrade weapons and body armor, this game a lot to offer.

content:
Posted: January 4
												I honestly believe Radical Entertainment though up this game, went around to other developer studios learning what they did wrong and right in games in the past, took the 'right' pile, tossed it in the toilet and flushed it down, and started building the 'wrong' pile into some unholy altar.Seriously. EVERY... SINGLE... THING... in this game is a TEXTBOOK example of "what NOT to do in video games" that you'd get in a 101 class.Terrible controls. Terrible plot. Terrible music- maybe. Sound was INSANELY LOW compared to everything else on my computer- even when maxed. I literally had to TRIPLE the volume of my speakers to be able to hear it at a decent level. Terrible graphics. Terrible controls. Oh wait- I said that already. Well it's important to re-emphasize because the controls and mechanics made the game BORDERLINE unplayable. And I use that world with the utmost intention. If it had a SINGLE thing worse with it's controls- it would have been straight up unplayable. The game until a certain point was so easy it was impossible to enjoy. Then after that point they cranked the meter up to 11 to the point it was entirely unfair. Permanent stunlocks. ONE HIT KOs that you CANNOT avoid.NEVER. EVER. EEEEEVER... buy this game. EVER.I got this game at 75% off on a sale. I feel like walking up to the developers studio and demanding that 25% I paid back as a refund, then the 75% I didn't added on to compensate for my pain and suffering. This game was THAT bad. I've only ever quit one other game in my entire LIFE- witcher 2. And that was because it was LITERALLY unplayable due to issues with the port to PC. At least I knew within the first 3 minutes of witcher 2 that it was going to be nothing but pain and suffering and I didn't actually suffer through the ENTIRE thing.I played through the game start to finish (as quickly as humanly possible...) so no one can say I didn't give it a chance. It had it's chance 100 times over as far as I'm concerned. I am unfortunate enough to have bought prototype 2 at the same time as part of the franchise pack when the game was on sale. Needless to say- I will not be installing that any time soon.

number of helpful: 11 of 34 people (32%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 28, 2014
												Prototype is an action-adventure open world game.You are Alex Mercer, a man without memory armed with amazing superhuman powers and the option to go most anywhere you like and do most anything you want once you get there.A virus outbreak has claimed Manhattan, forcing the island into a military quarantine. The infected citizens turning the population into mutants.The main story path is entirely linear. The missions are a sloppy mix of poorly paced ideas. Long missions involve simply going from one end of Manhattan to the other, while some of the short missions are climactic sieges and battles. Missions can be brutally challenging, often because of the uncooperative auto-lock system. Boss battles are much longer than they need to be and more often test your endurance rather than your skill.As you work your way through the game, you will earn experience points that can be used to unlock new and ever more exotic powers. Experience points are also the only thing you get by finding collectibles.The graphics are not the best, buildings and environments are ugly, so the world is not a place you want to explore. All in all, the awful boring and repeating missions and linear gameplay ruins the overall experience.Sounds 5/10Graphics 5/10Gameplay 6/10Atmosphere 5/10If you liked my review, please feel free to follow me and/or my curator group:http://steamcommunity.com/id/Ov3RT4K3R/myworkshopfiles/?section=guideshttp://steamcommunity.com/groups/orcollective#curationAlso feel free to check out my YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC83DYCmrWfl9ttrhX54jmWA

number of helpful: 8 of 39 people (21%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 26, 2013
												This game sucks.Want an in-depth review why this game sucks?  I found the sound messed up really hard so I could barely hear the dialogue when there was any.  It didn't stop me from understanding the story, but it did♥♥♥♥♥♥me off.  The story is boring.  It's a typical amnesiac with super powers trying to figure out the past.  I liked it better when it was the Bourn Identity.Gameplay started out funny but immediately got stale.  I really don't care for stealth missions and I didn't see a need for them in this game, but it went ahead & gave me stealth missions anyway.  The whole thing felt poorly balanced.  You're this super ultra killing machine and there's always a seemingly infinite number of soldiers on the screen all spread out shooting at you at all times and you're trying to kill enough guys to keep regenerating health.  Then they introduce these mutant alien things that take for god damn ever to kill.  I got really tired of fighting those things after about the 28th time.You can steal vehicles, but it wasn't really adding anything to the gameplay.  About 8 or so missions in, I just got bored of the game and decided this wasn't worth finishing.  I was on normal and I started out laughing like "hahaha this is so easy" to having a heart attack trying to finish a mission.  I get that there were more super powers to upgrade, they seemed mostly useless from the description.  The novelty of the game wears off after about half an hour or so.  It just didn't seem like it was worth finishing.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2012
												The graphics may not be much compared to the Crysis-es and the Battlefield 3's (although Prototype's draw distances and dynamic LoD are impressive), but I have a hard time describing the gameplay as anything other than "perfect." The variety of powers and the ways in which you can combine them in battle with the occasional rocket launcher, tank or helicopter thrown in the mix, and the fluidity with which you can scamper about the cityscape are amazing and intoxicating. Top it off with heapings of diverse side-quests and the ever-growing feeling that you are a god among men (mere ants, really, as far as Alex Mercer is concerned) and you're in for a wicked good time. It's also consumable in small bursts - two to three hours seems to be my average session time - which you might appreciate if you're the working type.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												  To start, the port of the game is acceptable. The game's highest resolution setting is 720p, and the graphics certainly aren't very impressive for a 2009 PC game. InFAMOUS looks better on PS3 really, and it came out at the exact same time. I played this game with a controller, so I can not tell you if the mouse and keyboard controls work well. The controls with a controller are alright. They aren't as precise as I'd like, but their good enough to keep the gameplay enjoyable. I experienced a couple crashes, but the game was fairly stable overall.  The gameplay is better than the port and is a nice bit of mindless fun. You can slice, throw, crush, and consume people by the dozen. The homicidal maniac within the player will have a blast butchering helpless soldiers for quite a while. However, eventually your inner homicidal maniac will realize there's nothing else to do but kill kill kill, and he or she will begin to grow tired of the indiscriminate mass murder. You'll probably reach this point before you finish the game, especially after half the enemies become super soldiers, large mutants, tanks, and various other enemies that will knock you about stunning you constantly and throwing you around like a baseball among a group of American children. Getting around the city is quite enjoyable. There's just something satisfying about jumping 50 feet into the air and gliding around New York, but this also begins getting old with time.   The story is forgetable, but if you're buying a game where you play as a superpowered mass murderer for story, then you're clearly looking in the wrong place.  This game fills a good few hours with hack and slash joy, but outstays its welcome. I'd recommend you get it on sale.

												This game has more freedom than the US Constitution!  The parkour system in this game is amazing.  I loved running around, jumping, flying.  Sometimes I wouldn't even bother with missions or people and I would just parkour around the world, feeling like a badass.  The parkour challenges were also something I enjoyed greatly.The violence was pretty fun too, body slamming, stealing tanks and choppers, blowing up buildings, hunting for targets to consume, smashing people, slicing people, shooting people, sneaking into military bases.And it has New Game+!  Great for replayability.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 19, 2014
												Gameplay works, it's fun as hell and the powers are inventive. Your effectly "The Thing" you able to perfectly replicate any person and your body can be shaped and twised into devestating weapons on the fly.  Along with that, Movement is smooth and responsive, besides a few hiccups, it was after all one of the games that defined the super hero sandbox. The story, though bland gets the job done, but it's what had me stop playing. Don't get me wrong, it's a good game and worth the 20 bucks if you buy it not on sale, it's just I could not buy the protangoists "anti-hero" angle the story was trying the sell me...which causes the rest to fall apart as they attempted to make the enemies you fight "Blackwatch" so sterotypcially evil might as well give them snidely whiplash mustaches and kick puppies. To be fair I am only 13 hours into the game so I don't know how far I got into the story, but still..I am recomending it as game to buy..just that little problem I had with the story stacked up enough to where I didn't want to play anymore. Eh maybe someday I can come back and complete it.

												3rd person hack and slash with a unique delivery. At it's core it's essentially an expanded version of a "light light heavy" type of combo system but with the movement physics and the environment structure you can effectively chain an infinite number of attacks switching on the fly between attack forms all while darting from rooftop to street to helicopter to street to gliding high above the streets to wherever you feel like it. 												This game....is one of the few AAA titles that rolled out in its time that was not only difficult (to a degree), but wasn't awful.   Sometimes I still install and play me a little bit of Prototype.  Unfortunately, the IP has been cancelled for all further sequels; Prototype 2 was barely able to release, as this decision occurred before Prototype 2 went for sale. Prototype 2 is a nice conclusion and I suggest picking up both games.    This one, however, has you as Alex Mercer, and as you go through the plot, you find you can "play the villain" recklessly and enjoyably to kick off your after work stress.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 21, 2013
												It's an open world game where you run faster than the cars. I've been wanting this since Vice City.I really like the action in this game. There's a good variety of weapons, some of them (the ones growing out of Mercer) have very wide move sets, which expand as the game goes on. The combat overall feels tightly paced, what with all the recovery animations and slow-mo, but I never really felt it was overdone. There's a nice bit of escallation, too, with both the mutants and the army getting a bit sillier with every chapter, and you getting new powers to deal with them.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												Overall a fun game.  The story is basically resident evil.. virus outbreak although unlike it you are insanely overpowered even on hard diff..   I like the fact that you fight both the military and the infected however the AI on the military is just sad you can literally do the most insane♥♥♥♥♥♥right in front of them and they won't react never mind the fact that you are obviously not human or that you are supposed to be a "priority target" even if you do get in trouble you can kill all of them or evade them without much of a struggle.    The infected are even less of a threat then the military. Once you learn the move set of the enemy they become closer to tedious then to a challenge including what is supposed to be bosses which just take more time to kill and are still easy to evade sins you are extremely fast.   Apart from the protagonist characters somehow don't feel complete.  The gameplay is pretty cool. Basically you are very fast and agile. Most of the time you will be jumping from one rooftop to another. Has a good variety of weapons and powers and you can even steal tanks and helicopters from the military and use them to your advantage. The stealth system is just about the only thing i dislike in the gameplay sins all the NPC's are blind, deaf and suffer from a rare disorder in which their mind goes blank and forget everything every 5 seconds or they might as well be in a coma.  I'd go ether way with the recommendation depends on what you want to play.  Even with all the issues it has it is still fun to go fight endless waves of enemies and see how long you are going to last. That is until you learn how to heal up fast and that the waves are not actually endless...

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
												Right so It's been some time since I've bought and played this game and now I'm reviewing this which might have been a tad bit too late? but let's get down to the facts. This game isn't the best, but it's good! I'm not a performance hunter like other people so there wasn't much of a problem for me. This game isn't exactly "new" so I'm not sure why people're trying to pick on. So far the story has been on a steady and interesting pace and the ending was prety well planned too. The only cons that I ever see in this game was the controls and the challenges. The amount of spam dash just for a single short flight is just annoying -.- and the challenge mission isn't much of a challenge either. Logic doesn't click either when I could throw a hunter without increasing heat while holding up a zombie will instantly mark me as a threat. Overall, the game is a fun experience for me, hours not wasted!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
												I will admit, I am a slight sadist and evil when it comes to games like this. If it involves doing some very cruel things for fun like assimilating others into your memories to accumulate more knowledge and power, then I'll do it without hesitation.This game is for those like me. Those who need a wide open area, a neat selection of awesome powers to pull off various ways of killing enemies and a whole lot of time!The selection includes:Whiplash - Whip your enemies and tear them in half, cling onto helicopters and pull yourself to them or hit them several times from far away even while in mid-air and cause them to plummet to their doom.Musclemass - Wanna play more normally, on foot, beat the living snot out of people and send them flying? You can do just that and plenty more!Hammerfists - Pounding things into the ground sound like your style? Send tanks into the concrete with each smash? Do an elbow drop from several feet high and do devastating damage when you land? This is the one for you!Blade -  Sever your enemies in a clean half, swing your blade around and around, tearing those apart around you, sending heads and limbs alike flying.That was just the abilities you can use. You can do so much more like:Thermal vision - See enemies through smoke and obstacles at the expense of decreased vision range.Infected vision - Highlight those with the BLACKLIGHT virus as well as military units.Keep in mind it muffles all your other senses like hearing in order to focus on his sight.You can also disguise! Assimilating others will not only restore your health but you will take on their appearance! Convert into an everyday citizen or even the military! Act inconspicuous amongst the enemy, take down important targets, stay out of their sight and certain equipment and they won't even know you're there!One offensive and defensive power may be active at a time. Using any of your powers while disguised completely negates the current disguise.There's also a really fun mechanic called Devastators. You need to be in Critical Mass (a state of almost dead or the complete opposite, having excess stored biomass and increased health). They include:- Tendril Barrage: Fires impaling tendrils from your body in all directions.- Groundspike Graveyard: Erupts massive spikes from the ground all around you.- Critical Pain: A single beam of hardened biomass protrudes from your hands to severely damage a single target.While you sprint, you automatically hop over cars, barriers and other obstacles without loss of momentum. You will also knock any humanoids aside without stopping if they get in your way.Your jump height can accel upwards to five-story buildings. You will scale any buildings you come in contact with.Devastating drops cause a shockwave beneath you. Falling height also factors into a bunch of your attacks.This game is extremely fun and a great stress reliever. If you like variety like me, you'll like this game.I recommend it to everyone who can get their hands on it!

The story is ♥♥♥♥ing awful, and none of the characters are likeable or interesting. If you don't care about the story, the dark, angsty, monotonous tone of the game will become very draining.Some parts of the game are extremely difficult, and every time I overcame such challenges I never felt a sense of accomplishment. It was never a matter of problem solving or honing my skills, but rather a matter of fluke, or exploiting one of game's poorly designed mechanics.What made me stay to the end was the freedom and power the game provides you. Sprinting up the side of a building at 60 kmph while throwing cars at old ladies is a unique experience, one that I have found nowhere else.Also apparently it runs terribly on AMD card, but mine seemed to handle it fine. (390)Recommended to those who like action-platformers with a focus on combat, and can deal with terrible stories and messing around with config files. Get it on sale.

Pros:♥♥♥♥♥♥looks like Guyver+I loved John Carpenter's The Thing+Zombies+Immersive world+Side quests are rewarding+Meaty body giblets+Has a Story Mode+Cons:-Story can get confusing-Where is Dana?This is a fantastic biopunk game, which simply must be played. Of course, Activision's "sterling" reputation in previous years has been a warning for most of there games, but Prototype seems to be an exception. Although I played this game a whole SIX YEARS after its release, this is still a solid game. It deficiencies in quality graphics are more than made up by the ground breaking world design and ai for its time. What feels like a hundred different cars, zombies, soldiers, and civilians in an ever changing map runs very smoothly. Now this isn't much for the standard computer now, but just how all these actors interact is astounding. Cars will swerve away from zombies and have car crashes while helicopters swoop by over head and the distant gunfire of a soldier can be heard. When playing this game I couldn't help but get immersed.9/10 -It's like those really good spiderman games turned spiderman into The Thing, make him wear a leather jacket, and fight zombies.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
												"I can be anything...Become anyone...Absorbing every memory untill I can remember who I am...And who...Deserves my wrath."   Somehow I missed this game in 2009 and found it only in 2014. And now, after I've completed it, I can easily say that "Prototype" is one of my favourite games.   Of course it's nothing more than a simple slasher, if you judge by gameplay. But somehow it's still very interesting to play.I personally like the storyline. Love it so bad! I can feel the anger of the Alex Mercer, a man who has lost everything - his girlfriend, his sister, his memories. But he gained strange powers and lead by them he can restore everything. At least he can try. And he unleashes his anger upon his enemies, upon everyone who stays on his way.   Like that you go through the game, becoming more and more awesome. More powerful. More invincible. More cruel. You're getting closer to your goal and every person you consume helps you to reveal the truth.    Who released the virus? Who did this to Alex Mercer? And can you fix all of this? Play "Prototype" and find out.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												  To start, the port of the game is acceptable. The game's highest resolution setting is 720p, and the graphics certainly aren't very impressive for a 2009 PC game. InFAMOUS looks better on PS3 really, and it came out at the exact same time. I played this game with a controller, so I can not tell you if the mouse and keyboard controls work well. The controls with a controller are alright. They aren't as precise as I'd like, but their good enough to keep the gameplay enjoyable. I experienced a couple crashes, but the game was fairly stable overall.  The gameplay is better than the port and is a nice bit of mindless fun. You can slice, throw, crush, and consume people by the dozen. The homicidal maniac within the player will have a blast butchering helpless soldiers for quite a while. However, eventually your inner homicidal maniac will realize there's nothing else to do but kill kill kill, and he or she will begin to grow tired of the indiscriminate mass murder. You'll probably reach this point before you finish the game, especially after half the enemies become super soldiers, large mutants, tanks, and various other enemies that will knock you about stunning you constantly and throwing you around like a baseball among a group of American children. Getting around the city is quite enjoyable. There's just something satisfying about jumping 50 feet into the air and gliding around New York, but this also begins getting old with time.   The story is forgetable, but if you're buying a game where you play as a superpowered mass murderer for story, then you're clearly looking in the wrong place.  This game fills a good few hours with hack and slash joy, but outstays its welcome. I'd recommend you get it on sale.

content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												Overall a fun game.  The story is basically resident evil.. virus outbreak although unlike it you are insanely overpowered even on hard diff..   I like the fact that you fight both the military and the infected however the AI on the military is just sad you can literally do the most insane♥♥♥♥♥♥right in front of them and they won't react never mind the fact that you are obviously not human or that you are supposed to be a "priority target" even if you do get in trouble you can kill all of them or evade them without much of a struggle.    The infected are even less of a threat then the military. Once you learn the move set of the enemy they become closer to tedious then to a challenge including what is supposed to be bosses which just take more time to kill and are still easy to evade sins you are extremely fast.   Apart from the protagonist characters somehow don't feel complete.  The gameplay is pretty cool. Basically you are very fast and agile. Most of the time you will be jumping from one rooftop to another. Has a good variety of weapons and powers and you can even steal tanks and helicopters from the military and use them to your advantage. The stealth system is just about the only thing i dislike in the gameplay sins all the NPC's are blind, deaf and suffer from a rare disorder in which their mind goes blank and forget everything every 5 seconds or they might as well be in a coma.  I'd go ether way with the recommendation depends on what you want to play.  Even with all the issues it has it is still fun to go fight endless waves of enemies and see how long you are going to last. That is until you learn how to heal up fast and that the waves are not actually endless...

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
												If you're a fan of sand-box games, I can recommend picking this one up when it's on sale. It's a mess of an experience and tries to pad itself with missions that require you to repeat activities or run across the world just to show off the fact you can fly about with gore shoowing out of your wrists. Mercer is completely unsympathetic, and the story collapses on itself when you think about it for more than five seconds.But it's fun. There's something primal about dropping down into a group of twenty soldiers and just tearing them apart before devouring their commander so you can call down artillery on their heads. It's ultimately ironic when they give you all these powers and upgrades, it's impossible to use nearly any of them because of how predators hunt you down and rockets home in on your location. Often missions devolve into hiding behind buildings, eating civs and waiting for a chance to rush back in and deal a littel damage. The bosses are definitely the low part of the game; they are all immune to even your basic attacks and it comes down to cheesing your way to victory.Glad I played it, because it really helps me appreciate where games have come from and where they are going. Sort of Infamous' lesser brother.

There's a variety of different ways to play and it lets you choose your own style which I like a lot. The different power-ups and upgrades alone are what should keep you playing, with each added power it gives you more freedom to do things the way you want to.

Plays better with a gamepad than on keyboard/mouse, which makes it slightly less than a great game. Attention publishers/developers: if your game is going on a PC, make sure to spend the money to make the controls PC specific, not just a direct mapping from the gamepad controls.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												Now then, where to begin:TL;DR: get the console versions, the PC port is not good at all, but the game is good.The PC port is not optimised, so the frame-rate will chug when smoke &/or particle effects are going on, there is no option to play it in windowed mode and the timers in the PC version seem to be lowered for no apparent reason. Many cheap deaths as well from enemies you couldn’t see doing huge attacks. Also the lock-on system is garbage since it only shows priority targets one should remove first rather then what the player wants to target.All that said the game is good. The different attack styles one can use to kill enemies are really visceral. But what I will praise to the end is the movement system. If you play this game you will feel absolute joy just running amok on Manhattan Isle, mainly just running around like a mad Sonic the hedgehog killing NPCs as you please.I will say now I haven’t finished the final boss battle. The last segment of the battle is timed and because the timers are lowered on the PC version you won’t have enough time to actually finish it.So get the console versions: either the Xbox 360 or the PS3 version. The PC I don’t recommend either way. But it’s worth experiencing the pleasure of the movement system alone for the game.

												Activision's prototype for a game with no play-testing.  Controls are sloppy and often confusing.  Difficulty curve is all over the map: some "hard" events are trivial and other "easy" ones are nearly impossible.  Story had real potential but is too fragmented by the sandbox gameplay constantly disrupting it.Worth maybe $2.50 or so if you can grab it on sale, but really...just get Saint's Row 4 instead.  They took all the best and fun movement from Prototype and un-f*cked the rest of the game so people could actually enjoy it.

												Gameplay works, it's fun as hell and the powers are inventive. Your effectly "The Thing" you able to perfectly replicate any person and your body can be shaped and twised into devestating weapons on the fly. Posted: February 8, 2015
												The story is kinda cool and it would make a good movie if it was done right. but the thing that makes this game so addictive and awesome is how well the unique concept is carried out. It's just... simply... very ♥♥♥♥ing cool and loads and loads of fun. The character upgrade system is also well thought out and you get upgrades at a pace that fits mastering each new move and/or combo. The action is intense and gets even more intense as the game progresses and the stuff you can do is really awesome and fun. I should probably play through again and use the heli's less, but they were so much fun!!!One thing that's weird though in the game is the AI. While half of the city is in chaos, the other half of the city is just gingerly getting on with their days, oblivous to the other half being infected by hideos mutants tearing people limb from limb and infecting those that don't escape. I suppose though, that this is comparable to good old GTA where hiding from the cops for 5 minutes makes them forget that you've commited genocide and burned half the city down.

content:
Posted: November 18, 2014
												This game is absolutely dreadful. The plot is relatively unorigional with the whole disease strikes a city, city goes under siege, gunfire, people die, we're all having fun here. The storytelling is so bad that there's a freaking set of side missions specifically there to find little clippets of whatever is going on here (it becomes clear at the end, but the ending and the plot in the main storyline make the game feel kind of pointless) and don't even get me started on the voice acting. As fun as it is listening to Alex Mercer go on about how he needs to find some answers over and over again is, I'd much rather gouge my eardrums out with a grapefruit spoon. (or just play it on mute. that works too...)That being said, the only solace that makes up for the rest of the pile of unspeakable that is this game, is the fact that the power curve is flawless. Something about running down a new york street at 40 mph, vaulting over cars and trucks alike, then jumping and clearing a 30 story building just to start running up the side of the empire state building, doing a flying leap off, and bullet diving into the earth so hard that the entire black turns to shambles is entertining, if not extremely satisfying. Especially near the end, I looked at the action I was pulling off, and told myself "dang... I am powerful."2/10most fun I've ever had while playing a video game. would recommend.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												The chief theme here will be broad strokes, which is what Prototype has. It's got the framework of a bunch of cool stuff, and it works to an extent, but there's ample room for improvement in everything. Take for example, the movement. You can climb and jump around most anything, and going in a single direction feels awesome most of the time, you can glide and dash and leap to your heart's content. But, if you're trying to get a tricky collectable from atop an antenna or building, Alex will often tweak out and flip over and around everything in sight, and it's quite a job to wrestle him into precise movements. Want to turn left or right? Hope you've got a few seconds cause unstoppable forces don't turn on a dime. Another example: Do you hate collateral damage? Don't even, cause there is nothing you have that won't wipe out a 90 degree arc about 10 feet in front of you at least. You're going to be smashing civvies and other innocents all the time, and the game gives you a nice running total of how many families you've ruined after each fight, so good luck sleeping I guess.The actual in-game storyline is, nyeh? It's okay, it gives me an excuse to destroy all this junk, and it joins up all these events just fine. There were a couple of standout moments, but ultimately it was pretty by the numbers. It does tend to wrench control out of your hands to show you things during missions, or straight up transport you across the map afterwards, which can be annoying. The Web Of Intrigue though? That's some good stuff right there, loads of dropped hints and filling in the gaps, much speculation and other really cool junk. I spent ages just cruising the city looking for targets cause they were so interesting. Word of advice though, never skip a target movie, cause good luck remembering the name and then finding it in the hundred-something strong web.Combat: Losing relies chiefly on some very dubious things: Unavoidable chip damage, homing attacks, and super-damaging stunlocks. It's not that it's not challenging, cause you will die if you're not paying attention, but it's really going through the motions of action/reaction to the above three. Some cooped-in boss battles can make the game feel hard, and especially early in the game when you're not very powerful. Oftentimes you'll find yourself cheesing fights by staying on the move and chipping at stronger foes from range, because moving in for actual damage provides them with too many opportunities to stun/grab/hit you and it's not worth the risk. It makes fights more of a chore than fun sometimes, and that's not so great. Health is relatively easy to come by, by grabbing and eating mooks, but it makes every mistake another chore, since everything big hurts you so much you'll have to find and consume 2-3 of the little guys safely before you can re-engage. It skews the pacing and atmosphere of fights quite a bit, and it's often more advantageous to just bug out. Unless, of course, you're doing a scripted story mission or event that requires you to clear an area, in which case hunker down for the long haul. The AI isn't very smart, not at all, but they are numerous and widespread. It's not about outsmarting them, it's about outsmarting the group and learning to play the way they work to your advantage. Stealth isn't, really, but it does what it needs to and works within the larger framework. Many of the stronger enemies are niusances rather than challenges, but again you gain the powers to gib them or to lose them fairly early on, so it's not really too big of a deal.Speaking of powers, those are pretty cool. You get a bunch of different arms, some defensive stuff, some supports, and they all have a use. You'll probably find yourself favouring one or two though, since there's quite a bit of redundancy between them. I'd have liked to see some more differentiation, but only a small fraction are mandatory so I guess not having everything must be allowed for. There's lots of stuff to spend your money on, special moves for each power as well as ones for plain old fisticuffs, movement and health upgrades, super moves, the store really does overflow with stuff. The movement too, once you figure out how to do it right, it's a joy to traverse the city and the challenges become simple matters of route rather than speed. You can fly and dash and grab walls and leap and dive, there really are a lot of things you can do and that's great. Also, when you enter the power radial selection everything slows down for a second to let you pick, and that's awesome.While it's not perfect, Prototype has one excellent quality: Not many other games make you feel this powerful, this badass, all of the time. You have a couple of dozen ways to destroy the dude that's ineffectually pinging at you with his rifle, and you have so much health that you can afford to decide. If he brings ten friends, it still doesn't really matter cause you can just nab one and chuck him at the others and then elbow drop the rest before zipping up a building and being five blocks away before backup even thinks of arriving. If some tougher guys decide to chase you, you're stronger and faster than them so just hit them with a ventilation unit and disappear, because you can. It broaches on God Game territory sometimes, but you're running around on the ground being all-powerful, and that feels really good.+Fun as all hellOodles of powers and upgradesFeels godlike, manOptions, options, options-Poor PC controlsCombat can be cheap at timesShowing it's age graphicallyIn the end, Prototype was worth the time I put into it, and despite the above tirade, the good outweighs the bad. Much of it is just frustration about what could have been great but ended up being just good. But, that still leaves you with a good, fun game, with tons of things to do and stuff to see, and a lot of extra storyline junk for those interested.

												Meh. So I got this game on sale and I guess it is worth it but proceed with caution. This game is hard as hell. It's also very repetitive. People who say this game is a GTA game on steroids, are very wrong. This game is nothing like GTA. Far from it actually. The games glitches are constant, the story is pathetic, and the gameplay has some getting used to. It's a fun game but only for the beat down part. The sandbox element is there but don't expect much from it. If you're playing for story, look else where. The story is stupid and the missions are sometimes so unbearable. Here's a run down of a typical missionGo to doctor*5 minutes laterDoctor wants to to kill♥♥♥♥♥♥for him *45 minutes later of contantly getting blown up by tanks and helicoptorsDoctor tells you he can't help you*MISSION COMPLETEDThat's a majority of the story and the game itself. So overall, this game is passable but if it's on sale, get it. You may find yourself enjoying it more than I do.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												Now then, where to begin:TL;DR: get the console versions, the PC port is not good at all, but the game is good.The PC port is not optimised, so the frame-rate will chug when smoke &/or particle effects are going on, there is no option to play it in windowed mode and the timers in the PC version seem to be lowered for no apparent reason. Many cheap deaths as well from enemies you couldn’t see doing huge attacks. Also the lock-on system is garbage since it only shows priority targets one should remove first rather then what the player wants to target.All that said the game is good. The different attack styles one can use to kill enemies are really visceral. But what I will praise to the end is the movement system. If you play this game you will feel absolute joy just running amok on Manhattan Isle, mainly just running around like a mad Sonic the hedgehog killing NPCs as you please.I will say now I haven’t finished the final boss battle. The last segment of the battle is timed and because the timers are lowered on the PC version you won’t have enough time to actually finish it.So get the console versions: either the Xbox 360 or the PS3 version. The PC I don’t recommend either way. But it’s worth experiencing the pleasure of the movement system alone for the game.

												Hey, very good game for this price (5 €) ! The first hours of discover are so pleasurable. I may not have been recommanding this at 60€/$80, but at 5 €, there's absolutely no reason not to jump on it very fast.

Posted: December 27, 2011
												Prototype is a game about being the worst human being to ever walk the face of the planet.It is a game about pulling people in half,  turning your arms into sledgehammers and making a street full of chunky salsa, and carrying pedestrians to a rooftop to surf their bodies into freefall. You'll walk away. They won't.My favorite thing to do in Prototype is infiltrate a military base and slowly walk through it, using my protoplasmic tentacles to absorb and devour soldiers unseen. When there's only me and one other guy left, I drop my disguise and slowly walk towards him while he screams and shoots wildly. It's like being the monster in a horror movie, except most of them cut away before the final victim gets shredded.In the late game there are some seriously hard boss fights that will stop your progress dead unless you're an expert at hit-and-run. I have not finished this game, but I don't really feel like I needed to.There's a sequel coming. I can't wait to be even more of a♥♥♥♥♥♥

												I've played this game before I play Assasin's Creed or Batman series. So this is the game that makes me love third person, action genre. You play it as Alex Mercer, a "Prototype", a victim imo.I won't give any details or spoils but even after years, I remember most of the keypoints at the story, so its pretty solid.Also has nice graphics and performence for its release date, even that its dated still nothing really disturbs you. You won't regret.

content:
Posted: May 14, 2012
												Seems like i bought this game ages ago and finally got around to playing it.  Pretty fun game when you are running around just blowing stuff up; but once you get down to doing some of the missions (aka the actual game) things go down hill quickly.  It is fun to just run around the city roaming around killing people but the missions really restrict things which is pretty unnecessary.  You are supposed to be some badass yet even a single enemy can pretty much kill you because the way the combat is designed you have to dodge everything with no option to block so basically if you get hit you are going to keep getting hit, and then you get hit into a corner, then you get beaten to death by giant mutant things.  Is the game worth buying though?  Sure if you get it for like 5 bucks, but just know it is going to be pretty damn hard.  Not because the game is difficult, but because the occasional horribly designed missions and  boss fights are going to make it that way.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												I'd been unable to finish this game years ago but finally got around to finishing it and, you know what? It was the greatest feeling in the world. This game ROCKS, even with the bugs it has here and there. Honestly, I love this game WAY more than I like Prototype 2. That being because, (SPOILERS), I feel Alex Mercer is a wonderful protagonist that teeters on the edge of both hero and villlian, yet openly chooses to do more heroic deeds for the safety of New York. This in itself is a great build for him that I like much much more than his totally evil version in the second game.I'd definately recommend this game to anyone like me that just wants to to parkour like a godamn demon velociraptor around NYC without a care in the world.FYI if you're thinking of getting the game: There's a persistent glitch that causes video and audio to become unsyched and choppy during major cutscenes. It's never been and most likely never will be patched, and it's hard as hell to adjust your settings to get of too. I couldn't get rid of it at all, but either way it's not game breaking. You can still get all the information out of the scenes, even if it is annoying.TL;DR: Get the game, it rocks. It's got a bug or two, but it isn't at all game breaking.
